title: (x) Cacharel logo - similar to Sahara Bodoni {J. Edward Sanchez}
content:
whats the name of this font?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221061548im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cacharel_3615.jpg)
author: ephekto

comments.content: I can't find an exact match, but it's similar to [Sahara Bodoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221061548/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/sahara-bodoni/).

In case it's a helpful clue: I have a Cacharel sweater that my mom bought me  
in the late 80s\*, and the label has that same font, with the distinctive curl at  
the foot of the "h".

\* It still looks new - they don't make 'em like they used to.

hhp
It's similar to Bodoni Sahara Ultra.

Or in that regard, urw++'s fat face(which I also found named as itc fatface weirdly)  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/fat-face/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221061548/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/fat-face/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/fat-face/")
The classic fashion logos were almost all of them custom designed, but the suggested alternatives are excellent.
